Member Function Documentation

cv::vector< cv::vector< float > > LinkedLines::calculateAnglesOfConnectedLines ( cv::vector< cv::vector< cv::Vec4f > >  cLines)

A function that calculates the angle (slope) of a line for a cv::vector of lines.

void LinkedLines::connectRawLines ( cv::vector< cv::vector< cv::Vec4f > >  rLines,
int  maxDistance 
)

A method that will connect the rawlines into connectedlines by satisfying the following connectivity condition: A line is connected to another line if the max. distance between both is less than a threshold distance.

double LinkedLines::findDistanceBetweenPoints ( cv::Point  pt1,
cv::Point  pt2 
)

A function to calculate the euclidean distance between two points. Used in connectRawLines().

void LinkedLines::linkConnectedLines ( cv::vector< cv::vector< cv::Vec4f > >  cLines,
double  thresholdRatio 
)

A function that will link the connected lines, by satisfying the curvature condition. This function uses the calculateAnglesOfConnectedLines() and anglesHaveSameSign functions.

A function that will link the connected lines, by satisfying the curvature condition.

Member Data Documentation

cv::vector<cv::vector<cv::Vec4f > > LinkedLines::connectedLines

connectedLines are lines satisfying the connectivity condition (lines close to each other).
